meanings.definition: A person who does not cooperate.
meanings.sent1: The noncooperator refused to join the team for the project.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had a hard time dealing with the noncooperator in class.
meanings.sent3: The noncooperator at the office always brought their own lunch and never joined the group for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The noncooperator was like a lone wolf, always working independently.
meanings.sent5: The noncooperator stood out in the crowd, isolated from the rest.

meanings.definition: Not cooperating or willing to work with others.
meanings.sent1: The noncooperator attitude of the employee caused tension in the team.
meanings.sent2: Her noncooperator behavior made it challenging to complete the group project.
meanings.sent3: The noncooperator cat refused to play with the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather was a noncooperator, disrupting the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The noncooperator sky refused to clear up for the stargazers.
